newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine to issue T-bills on September 3.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine to issue T-bills on September 3.

text.p: Ukraine's central bank will auction three-month, six-month, nine-month and 12-month discount treasury bills on September 3, a central bank official said on Monday.
"For the first time we will auction our treasury bills with the new Ukrainian currency, the hryvnya," the head of the bank's capital markets and exchange department, Vitaly Migashko, told Reuters.

The central bank is setting the denomination of T-bills at 100 hryvnya and is not setting the issue volume in advance. Previously Ukraine's T-bills were issued in units of 10 million karbovanets, the old currency.

At the last auction of three-month discount T-bills on August 29, the bank sold 589.4 billion karbovanets worth of paper, with an average annualised yield of 57.30 percent. The average price was 8.750 million karbovanets.

At the last auction of six-month discount T-bills on August 29, the bank sold 692.9 billion karbovanets worth of paper, with an average annualised yield of 64.87 percent. The average price was 7.556 million karbovanets.
The Finance Ministry cancelled without explanation the last auctions of nine-month and 12-month bills, which were also scheduled for August 29.

At the previous auction of nine-month discount T-bills on August 20, the bank sold 770 million karbovanets worth of paper, with an average annualised yield of 56.21 percent. The average price was 7.040 million karbovanets.

At the last auction of 12-month discount T-bills on August 16, the bank sold 4.695 trillion karbovanets worth of paper, with an average annualised yield of 56.65 percent. The average price was 6.390 million karbovanets.
